alert.note: Alert for Ellis; Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 28 at 3:54AM CDT until October 28 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL ELLIS AND SOUTHWESTERN KAUFMAN COUNTIES... At 354 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the city of Scurry. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waxahachie, Ennis, Terrell, Red Oak, Kaufman, Palmer, Bardwell, Grays Prairie, Alma, Cottonwood, Bardwell Lake, Garrett, Scurry, Bristol, Pecan Hill, Oak Grove, Post Oak Bend City, Rosser, Oak Ridge and Crisp. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
